item.title: Priyanka Chopra: 'She was not going to be another pretty girl' - The Guardian
item.description:
Priyanka Chopra: 'She was not going to be another pretty girl'  The Guardian

It could have been any celebrity wedding: a former boyband star and an actor married in a lavish ceremony. There was a dedicated hashtag on Instagram. People Magazine scored the exclusive pictures. But this was India’s Rajasthan state, the bride was Priyanka Chopra, and during the five-day ceremony the groom, Nick Jonas, draped her in a mangalsutra – a traditional Hindu necklace she will wear until her husband’s death. The publicity blitz around “Nickyanka’s” nuptials has confirmed Chopra, 36, as the most successful Indian ever to make the leap from Bollywood star to American celebrity. In ...

item.title: Deepika Padukone reveals striking outfit from wedding to Ranveer Singh - CNN
item.description:
Deepika Padukone reveals striking outfit from wedding to Ranveer Singh  CNN

One of the biggest names in Bollywood, Deepika Padukone, has married fellow actor Ranveer Singh in a star-studded ceremony in Lake Como, Italy. While the wedding was a closely-guarded affair -- the couple reportedly asked guests to follow a strict no-photo policy -- pictures emerged Thursday showing the model-turned-actress adorned in red and gold, lavish colors traditionally favored by Indian brides. The wedding was a two-day affair with local media reporting that two ceremonies took place, a Konkani ceremony on Wednesday followed by a Sindhi one, to reflect Padukone and Singh's background...

item.title: Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas arrive in Jodhpur for wedding - CNN
item.description:
Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas arrive in Jodhpur for wedding  CNN

Speculation is growing over the long-awaited wedding of actor Priyanka Chopra and musician Nick Jonas after the couple was spotted in the Indian desert state of Rajasthan earlier this week. The couple announced their engagement in August on Instagram with Jonas posting a photo of him with Chopra, accompanied by the message: "Future Mrs. Jonas. My heart. My love." The announcement came after weeks of rumors that the couple had been dating. Now it seems they're finally ready to tie the knot. The bride posted a photograph of herself at her bridal shower in New York in October. "Love, laughter ...

item.title: Box Office: China Just Turned 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Into A Hit - Forbes Now
item.description:
Box Office: China Just Turned 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Into A Hit  Forbes Now

Paramount Vin Diesel’s xXx: Return of Xander Cage may be the (re)start of a beautiful franchise. The Revolution action sequel, distributed by Paramount/Viacom Inc., just snagged a $61 million debut weekend in China. That includes online service fees which don’t go to the studios and are now counted in the gross amount (this is a new thing concerning tabulating Chinese box office), absent which the total would be around $58.8m. That is still crazy good. That’s the biggest debut for a Hollywood import in China since Warcraft, twice as big as the over/under $31m debuts of Rogue One: A Star War...

item.title: 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Trailer: Vin Diesel Fights Franchise Fatigue With All-Star Cast - Forbes Now
item.description:
'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Trailer: Vin Diesel Fights Franchise Fatigue With All-Star Cast  Forbes Now

Paramount Pictures As promised by Paramount/Viacom Inc. and friends, today sees the debut of the newest theatrical trailer for xXx: Return of Xander Cage. The film opens on Jan 20, 2017, yet it is only the third or fourth genre sequel/reboot of the month, along with Amityville: The Awakening (assuming that Weinstein Company release finally comes out), Underworld: Blood Wars, and Resident Evil: The Final Chapter. Obviously, there is value in both of Sony’s sci-fi/horror action franchises, but xXx is something of a wild card. As I’ve noted before, there is something sadly ironic about this th...

item.title: Deepika Padukone Does Her Best To Save Vin Diesel In 'xXx: The Return of Xander Cage' - Forbes Now
item.description:
Deepika Padukone Does Her Best To Save Vin Diesel In 'xXx: The Return of Xander Cage'  Forbes Now

MUMBAI, INDIA – JANUARY 12: Vin Diesel and Deepika Padukone attend the fan event for Paramount Pictures ‘xXx: The Return Of Xander Cage’ on January 12, 2017 at PVR, Phoenix Lower Parel in Mumbai, India. (Photo by Ritam Banerjee/Getty Images for Paramount Pictures) The third edition of Paramount’s xXx franchise had its world premiere in India on Saturday, drawing a mix of qualified praise and scorn from the local critics but widespread acclaim for the performance of Bollywood star Deepika Padukone as a huntress in her Hollywood debut. The presence of the Bajirao Mastani and Piku star and her...

item.title: xXx: The Return of Xander Cage review – Vin Diesel goes full throttle in action-movie silliness - The Guardian
item.description:
xXx: The Return of Xander Cage review – Vin Diesel goes full throttle in action-movie silliness  The Guardian

Vin Diesel’s plump-necked, vest-wearing action hombre Xander “XXX” Cage has come lumbering back onto the big screen, delivering sleepy zingers in that growly laryngeal voice, for the first time since 2002. Sadly, it’s the least anticipated franchise renewal imaginable. Only the release of a new Police Academy film could cause less excitement. But Vin, great ridiculous beefcake lunk that he is, does provide us with some fun. Diesel became the action genre’s lost hero after the first XXX film, in which he played the skateboarding XXX-treme sports guy recruited by Samuel L Jackson to fight for...

item.title: Bollywood meets Hollywood as Indian stars wed in Italy - The Associated Press
item.description:
Bollywood meets Hollywood as Indian stars wed in Italy  The Associated Press

TREMEZZINA, Italy (AP) — Bollywood stars Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh are getting married at a villa on Italy's Lake Como that has screen credits of its own. Wednesday's ceremony at Villa Balbianello coincides with the fifth anniversary of the release of the couple's first movie together. The bridal party and guests arrived by boat and all wore shades of white, matching the white roses that dotted the ivy-covered columns of the villa's terrace. Private security guards stood watch from boats on the lake, along with Indian and international paparazzi. Villa Balbianello has been used as ...

item.title: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return of Xander Cage' Isn't Just Banking On Nostalgia - Forbes Now
item.description:
Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return of Xander Cage' Isn't Just Banking On Nostalgia  Forbes Now

We are just under a month away from the domestic release of xXx: The Return of Xander Cage and exactly three weeks from the film’s overseas debut. The Revolution (and friends) production is arriving courtesy of Paramount/Viacom Inc. in the states as well as France and Germany while Sony (which distributed the first two xXx movies) is handling Belgium and Univeral/Comcast Corp. is releasing the film in the Netherlands. I have not seen the 107-minute film and I have no idea if it’s remotely “good.” For that matter, I have no idea how it’s going to connect here and abroad when it starts its in...

item.title: Review: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Is Fast And Furious Fun - Forbes Now
item.description:
Review: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Is Fast And Furious Fun  Forbes Now

The Box Office: Paramount/Viacom Inc. opens xXx: Return of Xander Cage in 3,600 theaters (including IMAX and 3D venues) this Thursday night in North America. The $85 million action sequel will open in an additional 53 overseas markets, about 54% of the total footprint, including the United Kingdom, France, Spain, Germany, Mexico, Brazil and Russia. It will go wide in India after a sneak preview engagement last weekend, where it earned $4.2 million for the biggest such debut weekend ever in January for a Hollywood movie. The D.J. Caruso-directed action thriller, written by F. Scott Frazier, ...

item.title: Box Office: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Scores Boffo $20.3M Friday In China - Forbes Now
item.description:
Box Office: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Scores Boffo $20.3M Friday In China  Forbes Now

‘xXx: Return of Xander Cage’ image courtesy of Paramount Photo by George Kraychyk Well, it looks like xXx: Return of Xander Cage could be that somewhat rare big movie that underperforms in North America yet gets “saved” by China. Obviously, this is just one day’s worth of grosses, but the Vin Diesel action sequel just notched a whopping $20.3 million opening day in what is the second-biggest movie going market on the planet. To wit, and with inflation and exchange rates potentially playing a factor, that’s on par with the $18m opening day of Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation back in lat...

item.title: The 100-Crore Club: Bollywood's Next Blockbusters - Forbes Now
item.description:
The 100-Crore Club: Bollywood's Next Blockbusters  Forbes Now

100 Crore Club By Suparna Dutt For Bollywood, success means crossing the 100-crore ($15 million USD) mark at the box office. Most don’t, but these three upcoming releases are bound to be blockbusters. Judwaa 2 will bank on nostalgia; Padmavati will deliver a larger-than-life story; and Tiger Zinda Hai has the star power of both Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif. Read more about the controversy surrounding Padmavati here. Image credits: Vectors: Vecteezy; Judwaa 2 Art: Apple & Orange Pictures, Fox STAR Studios, Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment; Padmadvi Photo: Viacom18, Bhansali Productions; Tig...

item.title: Cannes 2017: Asia's Best And Worst Dressed Stars On The Red Carpet - Forbes Now
item.description:
Cannes 2017: Asia's Best And Worst Dressed Stars On The Red Carpet  Forbes Now

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan channels her inner Cinderella in this Michael Cinco gown at the 70th annual Cannes Film Festival. (Photo by Andreas Rentz/Getty Images). They may have been absent from the screen, but Asia’s biggest stars turned up in force for the 70th Cannes Film Festival. From India to China, South Korea and Japan – stars representing East and South Asia showed up in their gowns that at times resembled Disney’s princesses’ iconic costumes, and often came straight from the world’s most luxurious couture runways. But not everybody got it right. Check out who topped and who flopped wi...

item.title: Bollywood Alarmed By Rising Intolerance After Attack On Director - Forbes Now
item.description:
Bollywood Alarmed By Rising Intolerance After Attack On Director  Forbes Now

Bollywood film director and producer Sanjay Leela Bhansali, with his mother and his sister, film director Bela Sehgal. (Photo courtesy Getty) In the latest of an increasing number of attacks on free speech and artists in India of late, Bollywood director Sanjay Leela Bhansali was assaulted by a mob while filming his historical drama Padmavati, the most-anticipated Bollywood film of the year, in Jaipur last Friday. A hardline Hindu group in Rajasthan, Rajput Karni Sena, alleges that Bhansali’s film is “distorting history” in telling the tale of revered Hindu Rajput queen Padmini. The film is...

item.title: Nina Dobrev Plays Who Said It: Dom Toretto Or Xander Cage? - The Huffington Post
item.description:
Nina Dobrev Plays Who Said It: Dom Toretto Or Xander Cage?  The Huffington Post

Are you a Vin Diesel fan? Well, then you know his characters are kind of, sort of similar ― in that they’re all action heroes: Riddick, Dominic Toretto, Xander Cage. So, to test Diesel’s latest “xXx: Return of Xander Cage” co-star Nina Dobrev, The Huffington Post asked the actress to guess who said it, Dom or Xander, on a recent Build Series segment. See all the fun go down above. Produced by Gabe Piscione.

item.title: Box Office: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Tops $300M Worldwide - Forbes Now
item.description:
Box Office: Vin Diesel's 'xXx: Return Of Xander Cage' Tops $300M Worldwide  Forbes Now

Paramount Pictures As the headline suggests, xXx: Return of Xander Cage continued to be an overseas monster. The Vin Diesel/Donnie Yen/Kris Wu/Deepika Padukone action sequel bombed in North America with just $43.5 million thus far (less then first xXx‘s $44m opening weekend back in 2002) but went nuts in China last week. The film has now earned $134m (from a $61m debut weekend) meaning it is leggier than most Hollywood releases. The $85 million Paramount/Viacom Inc. release has now earned $263m overseas alone (the original xXx earned $277m worldwide in total) for a $308m-and-counting global...

item.title: India's Box Office Queen Deepika Padukone Re-Ups For Another 'xXx' Tour - Forbes Now
item.description:
India's Box Office Queen Deepika Padukone Re-Ups For Another 'xXx' Tour  Forbes Now

Director DJ Caruso has confirmed that Deepika Padukone will reprise her role in the next installment of the Vin Diesel-starring action franchise xXx. The 31-year-old Indian actress made her Hollywood debut in xXx: The Return of Xander Cage, playing the part of Serena Unger in the multi-cultural star-studded cast that included Diesel, Donnie Yen, Kris Wu, Tony Jaa, Samuel Jackson, Ice Cube, and in a cameo, soccer superstar Neymar. Bollywood superstar Deepika Padukone In the decade since her 2007 film debut opposite Shah Rukh Khan in the romantic musical Om Shanti Om, the Bangalore-born Paduk...

item.title: Friday Box Office: 'La La Land' Topping $250M Global, 'Resident Evil' And 'xXx' Drop Hard - Forbes Now
item.description:
Friday Box Office: 'La La Land' Topping $250M Global, 'Resident Evil' And 'xXx' Drop Hard  Forbes Now

‘Split’ image courtesy of Blumhouse and Universal In holdover news, Split is probably going to win its third weekend in a row, although it will have to settle for being no. 2 movie last night (cue that line from the end of The Sixth Sense that makes everyone cry). The M. Night Shyamalan thriller earned another $4.9 million yesterday, which was a drop of just 39%. We’re probably going to see a bigger dive for the weekend due to the Super Bowl, so expect a $13.8m (-46%) third weekend for a $97.9m 17-day cume. Yes, the Blumhouse and Universal/Comcast Corp. thriller is still reigning like a cha...

item.title: xXx: Return of Xander Cage review – yet more silly stunts - The Guardian
item.description:
xXx: Return of Xander Cage review – yet more silly stunts  The Guardian

There was always something a little off about the premise of the xXx films. It posits that, when facing global calamity, rather than a group of highly trained professionals like, say, Navy Seals, we would be better served by placing our trust in extreme sports enthusiasts. Those guys who take selfies while dangling off skyscrapers by a toenail and a tattoo? They are, in fact, the saviours of the world. Of course, credibility was never the point of this series that, buoyed by the dogged endurance of B-movie franchises such as The Fast and the Furious and The Expendables, returns to our scree...

item.title: Aditya Chopra Steps Into A Minefield With Ranveer Singh In 'Befikre' - Forbes Now
item.description:
Aditya Chopra Steps Into A Minefield With Ranveer Singh In 'Befikre'  Forbes Now

Vaani Kapoor and Ranveer Singh in ‘Befikre’ (Photo: Yash Raj Films) Bollywood filmmaker Aditya Chopra ventured way out of his comfort zone with Befikre, a Paris-set romantic comedy starring Ranveer Singh and Vaani Kapoor which launches in India and other markets on Friday. Determined to ensure the film had a totally different sensibility to the films he’d produced or directed, Chopra decided not to work with his usual collaborators, instead hiring an all-French crew. And he eschewed the three elements that had underpinned all his films – conflict, heightened emotions and intense romance – i...
